page.title: 16Thornley - Housing
page.content: The original{housing}in Thornley {dates from}the{sinking of the mine shaft. Housing was provided for those who worked in the mine. Later as the{village expanded, {council houses were erected}to provide homes for the{increased population. {Private houses}formed a very{small {proportion}of the total housing in the village. After the{mine closed}in the 1960's the population declined and many {families moved away}in search of work. The{colliery houses}were in need of {renovation}or{demolition.}A large proportion were demolished leaving large ares of the village{open for {rebuilding and development. Because of{poor employment {possibilities}in the area the need for extra housing was not urgent. The{open {areas remain open.
